name: PHILIDOR DEFENSE
idea: The solid response to 1.e4 e5 2.Nf3! With ...d6, Black defends e5 solidly but blocks the Bf8. The modern approach is ...Nf6, ...Be7, ...0-0, ...c6 then ...Nbd7 and ...Re8 preparing ...d5 or ...exd4 followed by ...d5. Philidor himself said 'pawns are the soul of chess' and this defense reflects that philosophy - solid structure over piece activity!
errors_white: Playing d4 too early: after ...exd4 Nxd4 Black is fine
Ignoring the ...d5 break: this frees Black's position
Trading too many pieces: helps Black equalize
errors_black: Blocking the Bf8 forever: find a way to activate it via ...g6 or ...Be7-f8-g7
Playing ...Bg4 too early: can be refuted by d4-d5
Being too passive: the Hanham setup with ...Nbd7 is more active
development: Defends e5 solidly but locks in the Bishop - it's the price to pay
Nf6 is natural but blocks ...f5, sometimes ...Ne7 is better!
Be7 first (frees the f8 square for the King), then look for ...f5
Nc6 or Nd7 depending on plan - Nd7 prepares ...f5 better
Kingside castle after ...Be7 - very safe position
...f5! is the liberating move - breaks White's chain and activates the Bc8

traps.name: Legal Trap
traps.desc: After 3.Bc4 Bg4?? (classical mistake) 4.Nc3 Nc6 5.h3 Bh5 6.Nxe5!! Bxd1?? 7.Bxf7+ Ke7 8.Nd5# mate! AVOID (Black): Never play ...Bg4 in the Philidor! Play ...Be7 or ...Nf6.

traps.name: Center Trap
traps.desc: 3.d4 exd4 (forced otherwise d5 gains space) 4.Nxd4 and White has an ideal center. If ...Nf6? 5.Nc3 Be7 6.Bf4 Black is passive. AVOID (Black): Play 4...Nf6 5.Nc3 Be7 then ...0-0 and ...Re8 to prepare ...d5.

traps.name: Endgame Trap
traps.desc: Normal position. If White plays 0-0 Be7 Re1 0-0 and Black can never play ...f5 because e5 falls! AVOID (Black): Play ...c6 and ...Qc7 to prepare ...d5, or ...h6 and ...g5 to prevent Bg5.

variants.name: Hanham Variation
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 g1f3 d7d6 d2d4 g8f6 b1c3 b8d7 f1c4 f8e7
variants.white_plan: Strong d4-e4 center. Play 0-0, a4 (prevents ...b5), then attack with Qe2, Rd1 and look to open the center.
variants.black_plan: Hanham structure: ...Nbd7, ...Be7, ...0-0, ...c6 then ...Qc7. Prepare ...d5 or ...f5 at the right moment.

variants.name: Philidor Counterattack
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 g1f3 d7d6 d2d4 e5d4 f3d4 g8f6 b1c3 f8e7 c1f4
variants.white_plan: Ideal center with Knight on d4. Develop Qf3 or Qd2, 0-0-0 possible for aggressive attack.
variants.black_plan: Play ...0-0, ...Re8, ...Nc6 or ...a6 then ...b5. The move ...d5! is the goal to equalize.

variants.name: Lion Variation
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 g1f3 d7d6 d2d4 g8f6 b1c3 b8d7 f1c4 f8e7 e1g1 e8g8 a2a4 c7c6
variants.white_plan: Stable position. Play Re1, h3, Be3 and look to break with d5 or attack the kingside.
variants.black_plan: The modern Lion! ...c6, ...Qc7, ...Rfe8, then ...Nf8-g6 and ...d5 or ...f5 to counter-attack.
